newsitem.title: USA: Wonderware completes deal, plans Q4 charge.
newsitem.headline: Wonderware completes deal, plans Q4 charge.

text.p: Wonderware Corp said on Friday it has completed the acquisition of its software distributor in Germany, and it will take a $1.3 million charge in the fourth quarter to account for the purchase.
The distributor, previously called ICT-Wonderware GmbH, will now be Wonderware GmbH and will serve as the company's headquarters for sales and support in Europe, Wonderware said in a statement.
Wonderware acquired a minority interest in the Munich-based joint venture company in December 1994.
The acquisition gives Wonderware a fully-functioning sales and distribution operation in Germany with offices in several cities staffed by 42 employees.

"It's important that we be able to deploy a direct sales force in Germany because major industrial companies prefer to deal directly with software suppliers rather than work through distributors," said Roy Slavin, Wonderware chairman.
The company said it plans to close its present European regional sales office in Amsterdam, and it will consolidate all management operations for eastern and western Europe in Munich.
